alert.note: Alert for Bay; Calhoun; Franklin; Gadsden; Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 8:32PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CST /830 AM EST/ SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Franklin, Gadsden, Leon, Liberty and Wakulla. In Panhandle Florida, Bay, Calhoun and Gulf. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CST /830 AM EST/ Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 731 PM CST /831 PM EST/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms will continue off and on through early Sunday morning. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 5 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Panama City, Lynn Haven, Panama City Beach, Callaway, Woodville, Carrabelle, Blountstown, Eastpoint, Apalachicola, St George Island, Quincy, Crawfordville, Midway, Port St. Joe, Tallahassee Community College, Florida State University, Florida A and M, Havana and St. Marks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
